Tom Henderson is a banned source on Famiboards. Please refrain from discussing or bringing his content here. For more information check the banned content list. - ngpdrew, meatbag, Lord Azrael

May 30, 2024

#7,553

Nintendo should make a hero shooter just like everyone else. Have it star a bunch of Nintendo character. And to make it different from the rest of the crowd, maybe not make it a shooter but make it more melee-based combat. And instead of 3D, make it 2D. And instead of taking down your enemies hit points, maybe have a mechanic where you need to push them off the level. Items could spawn to mix of the variety.

Just throwing ideas out there.

Wockio

Alolan Raichu enjoyer

Pronouns

He

May 30, 2024

#7,554

Nintendo should make a hero shooter just like everyone else. Have it star a bunch of Nintendo character. And to make it different from the rest of the crowd, maybe not make it a shooter but make it more melee-based combat. And instead of 3D, make it 2D. And instead of taking down your enemies hit points, maybe have a mechanic where you need to push them off the level. Items could spawn to mix of the variety.

Just throwing ideas out there.

That's a preposterous idea. No one wants to see Mario and Link fighting.

May 30, 2024

#7,563

can anyone put in a word with the calendar to skip tomorrow so we be in direct month?

but for real - what date are we expecting?

Australia said they're considering it

Just so I understand the timeline clearly:

Midori starts out as an Atlus leaker. Chill, relaxed.

Decides to retire after a good run of reliable leaking. Reddit threads salute her for her service.

Zippo starts talking shit. Calls her names or something.

Midori comes out of retirement, starts leaking everything she knows. Feral. Unhinged.

Flip 2 and 3 and you basically have it. We don't know what happened between her retirement and her coming back with sources at multiple new companies but yeah

Is there any more context to this? Did Midori have to correct some info shared, or something else?

Nate literally just got through saying a couple pages ago that people were getting upset at all the leaks, and then she tweeted that.

Similar to when @Derachi made a thread about his theory that she might be part of a viral marketing stunt by Sega and she relatively quickly tweeted that she doesn't work for Sega. She's possibly watching what's being said about her in forums and responding on twitter.

D36

I stand proud, because I can cook!

Pronouns

He/Him

May 30, 2024

#7,564

Am I allowed to say that I love that we have a girl leaker? Like she makes me feel how I’m pretty sure the Lady Ghostbusters was supposed to make me feel.

Yeah, it's refreshing after Emily Rogers retired.

#7,565

I hope the Direct is next week, I feel like Nintendo would want to get out of the way of SGF this year knowing devs will speak about next gen Switch games.

Week of the 17th is more likely.

That is the weird thing, they announced they will talk about the successor this fiscal, but nothing has been officially announced. How does that affect NDAs, I have no idea lol. The only people that have mentioned switch 2 are kickstarters because why not, but will any company say "this game is coming to the successor"? Yeah, someone will, and my bet is on ubisoft

#7,569

This whole thing of leaking supposed codenames for games is legit one of the stupidest things I've ever seen from a leaker/insider/whatever lol. It's so useless. Like, if it was just one or two codenames, it wouldn't be that bad, but this account just continues to do it over and over one after the other. How would they even have knowledge of all of these codenames anyway?

May 30, 2024

#7,576

She seems to think it is Zelda related due to the name being similar to Link's Awakening's codename "Richard". Though that was named after the character named Richard in the game (who is originally form For Whom the Frog Bell Tolls). I don't see there being any connection between Richard and Edward unless I am forgetting about something.

Might be best to assume that this is an assumption on her part unless she provides additional information.

May 30, 2024

#7,577

Midori back at it again

We're getting that Nintendo-developed AAA Fullmetal Alchemist game holy fuck

May 30, 2024

#7,579

Midori back at it again

Curious that she thinks it's connected to Zelda. I don't think this is really an obvious fit for the series. Most games have used spins on playing cards (usually King, also Jack, Joker, Queen), though there's also a fair amount of outliers like Triforce Heroes=Alice, SSHD=Shoebill, LA remake=Richard. So there's not really a hard-and-fast rule we could apply to try and pin down what this could be

Like most of Midori's codename leaks, not really sure this is useful for much besides potentially being able to look back and go "oh yeah, turns out she was right" at some future point

HockeyBird

Pokémon Trainer

Pronouns

He/Him

May 30, 2024

#7,581

Makes sense. If you run into a guy dressed up as Link at your local renaissance fair, what's his name most likely to be? That's right. Edward.

My apologies to all the Edwards out there for revealing your secrets.

SiG

I have a feeling Nintendo has a pretty tight lockdown on their future projects. I'm not sure these codenames are necessarily for their big projects.

LA remake was codenamed Richard because of the character in the game; is there another Zelda game with an Edward, or some reason to think of "Edward" as being connected to "Richard" (I get what she's going for with the Anna/Elsa angle on Switch Sports, but can't think of a famous Richard/Edward pairing)

#7,592

She’s not totally correct with her theory

• Ocarina of Time 3D - Queen

• A Link Between Worlds - Jack

• Majora's Mask 3D - Joker

• Breath of the Wild - U-King

• Link's Awakening (Switch) - Richard

Jack was a Link Between Worlds and other names are used for 3D games too. This mainly just confirms a Zelda game- not that it’s 2D.
